result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin Jo Bisonette was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 28, 2015.
Bond continues until signed up for probation.
Court orders all Victim's belongings be returned to Jessica within 5 days.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes: To be determined within 30 days and payable through probation.

$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF8.
$142.40 in Witness fees to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF8.
Court waives DNA surcharge.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Marin Bisonette Jr..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
-Not to possess Mark Bisonette Jr's personal ID, driver's license old or expired and/or credit cards ect.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Francis D. Collins, DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea, DF:  Martin Jo Bisonette appeared. Set for a prelim. There is an agreement. Court amends to 2 misdemeanors - 946.41 (obstructing) and 947.01 (Disorderly). Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charges and possible penalties, AS AMENDED for count one (obstructing) and count two (disorderly). Def pleads no contest. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of counts 1 & 2, AS AMENDED. Victim makes a statement. Court orders all of victim things be returned to Jessica within 5 days. S/T Martin Bisonette. 
Court orders: Counts 1 & 2 are concurrent - S/W 2 years probations with conditions: 
- Restitution to be determined within 30 days of today's date. 
- It is hereby ordered, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mark Bisonette Jr. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- Not to possess any of Mark B. Jr. personal ID, driver's licenses old or expired and/or credit cards, etc
- Court costs $243.00. Payable through probation
- Court costs $243.00. Payable through probation. 
Defendant to sign up for probation today. Bail continues until signed up. 
Defendant is advised of right to appeal.
Defendant's., NMM to Suppress Statements and to Suppress Evidence, Filed by Atty Andrea. hml
Atty. A. Andrea. gme

Certificate of Attendance - Witness. eif
Joseph J. $78.00
Mark B. $126.4
Preliminary hearing on January 28, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

No possession of use of personal identifying materials of Mark B. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mark B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
